title: Chilaquiles Verdes Topped with Fried Egg
desc: Delicious Mexican breakfast as spicy as you can handle, featuring crispy tortilla chips smothered in tangy salsa verde, crema, and fresh cilantro.
method: Heat salsa verde in a pan until warm.
Add tortilla chips and mix until coated.
Fry eggs in a separate pan.
Serve chilaquiles topped with fried eggs, crema, and cilantro.

title: Spaghetti Carbonara
desc: A classic Roman pasta dish with a creamy sauce made from eggs, Pecorino Romano, pancetta, and black pepper.
method: Cook spaghetti until al dente.
Fry pancetta until crispy.
Whisk eggs with Pecorino Romano and black pepper.
Combine pasta with pancetta and egg mixture off heat.
Serve immediately.

title: Japanese Matcha Pancakes
desc: Fluffy, soufflé-style pancakes with a hint of matcha, served with fresh berries and whipped cream.
method: Whisk together flour, baking powder, and matcha powder.
Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form.
Mix egg yolks and milk into dry ingredients.
Fold in egg whites gently.
Cook pancakes on low heat until fluffy.

title: Classic Caesar Salad
desc: A fresh salad with crunchy romaine lettuce, Parmesan cheese, crispy croutons, and a rich Caesar dressing.
method: Wash and chop the romaine lettuce.
Toss lettuce with Parmesan cheese and croutons.
Drizzle Caesar dressing over the salad and mix well.
Sprinkle black pepper to taste before serving.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
desc: A flavorful Indian dish featuring tender chicken in a spiced, creamy tomato sauce, served with basmati rice.
method: Marinate chicken with garam masala, cumin, and paprika.
Sauté the chicken in a pan until golden brown.
Add tomato puree and simmer for 10 minutes.
Stir in heavy cream and cook for another 5 minutes.
Serve hot with basmati rice.

title: Lemon Blueberry Muffins
desc: Freshly baked muffins with a burst of blueberries and a hint of zesty lemon, perfect for a sweet breakfast or snack.
method: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C) and grease a muffin tin.
Mix flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar in a bowl.
In another bowl, whisk eggs, milk, melted butter, and lemon zest.
Combine wet and dry ingredients, then fold in blueberries.
Pour batter into muffin tin and bake for 18-20 minutes.
Let cool before serving.
